thread.title: Former Cardinals IT manager grows new tech startup
thread.title_full: Former Cardinals IT manager grows new tech startup

author: Brian Feldt
title: Former Cardinals IT manager grows new tech startup
text: Former Cardinals IT manager grows new tech startup Feb 22, 2017, 10:54am CST Industries & Tags Brian Feldt Senior Reporter St. Louis Business Journal Share Brian Feldt Senior Reporter St. Louis Business Journal Home of the Day ​Ardent IT Solutions, a St. Peters-based startup that provides professional IT services… more Odilon Dimier | Photick Ardent IT Solutions, a St. Peters-based startup that provides professional IT services and consulting, expects to add 10 new jobs in the next few years to accommodate growth. According to its website, Ardent helps companies identify and correct problems with their systems and develop new and innovative solutions to meet their business’ technology needs and budgets. ​Ardent IT Solutions, a St. Peters-based startup that provides professional IT services… more Odilon Dimier | Photick For adding the jobs, the state of Missouri is offering Ardent up to $82,658 through the Missouri Works program, a state spokeswoman said. The company was founded in 2016 by Justin Klutenkamper and David Hunn . Both are St. Charles natives. Hunn worked for five years as manager of information technology for the St. Louis Cardinals before founding Ardent. Prior to his gig with the Cardinals, Hunn served as the chief technology officer of Tecvar, a Maryland Heights-based IT consultant where Klutenkamper also worked as general management. Brian Feldt covers technology, venture capital, startups, real estate and sports business. Home of the Day
